project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
According to the documentation [Data Collection policy|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Data+collection+policy], enabling/disabling data collection in JIRA Agile can be done by navigating to:
Administration > Add-Ons > JIRA Agile > JIRA Agile Labs > Analytics

However, when you follow the click path, you will only be able to see:
!labs_1.jpg|thumbnail!

The option to disable/enable it is missing.
fields.summary: Option for disabling Analytics in JIRA Agile cannot be found

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Currently, if the JIRA Administrator customise the screens, not to have the Epic Link and Sprint field and then perform an upgrade or uninstall/install the Agile Plug-in, these fields will be added on the screens back.

In some cases that the user has his screens precisely configured, it may generate some extra-work to the administrator adjust them back.

If it is like this by default, it should have some note in the release notes, or on the Agile official documentations, so the Administrator will be aware of this behaviour before upgrading, and will upgrade the plugin when having more time to adjust the screens.
fields.summary: Release notes should inform that Epic Name and Sprint Field will be added to screens.

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.summary: dg

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Currently the Control Charts information on time spent in a status, is most useful in retrospective of closed issues, because it doesn't show you how much time has already been spent in a status/column until the issue moves out of that status/column. Users of this chart are likely to have a faulty impression of how the project is going while tasks are still in progress.

It may probably help in-progress assessments to have a way to view real time information on how much time an issue has spent in statuses, even before the issue is moved along to the next status.
fields.summary: Real-time time spent in status data from Control Chart

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
The dropdown for selecting an epic in the Epic Burndown report sorts in the opposite direction as they appear on the Plan view; if an epic appears on the top of the Plan view, it will appear on the bottom of this report's dropdown.

(The Epic Report sorts its dropdown correctly, as a reference point.)
fields.summary: Epic Burndown report sorts epic dropdown incorrectly

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
The Epic Burndown chart seems to ignore whatever value is passed to it in the {{epic=}} query parameter. Following a link to this report for a particular epic instead produces a report for some other epic in the list. (On our instance, the "wrong epic" is consistent, and it is _not_ simply the latest epic viewed using this report.)

Steps to replicate:

1. Navigate to an Agile Scrum board.
2. Click "Reports" and select "Epic Burndown".
3. Select an Epic which is not the default one presented.
4. Copy the URL out of your browser.
5. Open a new browser window and paste in the URL.
6. Observe that you are not taken to the report for the correct Epic.
fields.summary: Epic Burndown report ignores 'epic' query parameter

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Dear Jira Agile team,

we've the attached error with our Agile add-on. If you want to open a board or create a new one you get this error. If you want to manage the boards you get a blank page.

After a re-index and a reboot we got an interesting "invalid license" error with every agile board. On the Manage Add-ons page was everything ok, but on the Jira Agile license detail page we had our old license (valid till 2012). Adding there our actual license helped to get rid of the invalid license error, but the attached error appeared.

Best regards,
Darius Kühn
fields.summary: Error with every Agile Board

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.summary: Reordering issues in Agile Plan view fails

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
*Steps to reproduce*
# Create a custom event in JIRA
# Associate the new event to the issue creation step of a workflow
# Create a new issue using the modified workflow

*Expected results*
Issue should appear successfully in the Agile board
 
*Actual results*
Issue does not show up in the Agile board, unless it has been updated with any action
Issue does not show up in the board filter as well as it doesn't have the Rank field to be ordered.
fields.summary: New issues not on Agile board when workflow fires custom event for issue creation

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
I work with multiple agile teams and regularly look at approximately 12 jira agile boards. The current dropdown in the agile tab shows nine recent boards, but if I want to look at other boards, I need to search through all boards in the company to find the board that I need to look at. 

Being able to favorite multiple boards, in a similar way to the dashboards would make working with multiple agile teams much easier.
fields.summary: Favorite multiple agile boards

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
As a Jira Agile Enterprise user, I would like to be able to customize what fields appear on cards in the Jira Agile Kanban board work view.  Currently, I am only able to see Issue ID, a picture of the assignee, issue subject line, and dots indicating age of tickets.  I would like to be able to configure cards differently from one board to the next, and see fields such as:
1) Date Created
2) Reporter
fields.summary: As a user, I would like to be able to customize what information appears in the cards in the Agile (Kanban) board in Work mode.

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Currently, if the user still using the default avatar on the creation, JIRA Agile Work board will use the username Initials as the avatar.

But, if user change the avatar even though it is from JIRA itself, it will use that avatar instead in the Work View. It will be the same when the user tries to change back the avatar to the default one.

Therefore, it would be useful if there is an option in the board configuraiton whether the user would like to use the avatar or the Initials.
fields.summary: Option to use revert back to using first-letter avatar

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
SO THAT...I can see what the latest tickets ready to be worked on are

ASSUMPTIONS
* there is an auto-refresh in the work/board view, why not on the plan view
* it is creating confusion when working scrumban, as the devs do not see the latest prioritisation

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA
* given tickets are ordered in priority order, with the most important at the top
* when i move tickets about
* then other people who are logged in are able to see the latest order of tickets without having to refresh the page
* given tickets are linked to different epics
* when i move a ticket from one epic to the other
*  then other people who are logged in are able to see the latest associated epic to the ticket without having to refresh
fields.summary: As an Agile JIRA dev user, I would like the plan view to auto-refresh

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Issue screen shows in right part of main window except People and Dates panels also Agile panel (div with id greenhopper-agile-issue-web-panel) for issues which belong to not-enabled Agile projects.

Agile panel should not be displayed for issues which do not belong to Agile enabled projects.
fields.summary: Non-Agile project's issues display greenhopper agile issue web panel

  Position: 112
	at org.postgresql.core.v3.QueryExecutorImpl.receiveErrorResponse(QueryExecutorImpl.java:2102)
	at org.postgresql.core.v3.QueryExecutorImpl.processResults(QueryExecutorImpl.java:1835)
	at org.postgresql.core.v3.QueryExecutorImpl.execute(QueryExecutorImpl.java:257)
	at org.postgresql.jdbc2.AbstractJdbc2Statement.execute(AbstractJdbc2Statement.java:500)
	at org.postgresql.jdbc2.AbstractJdbc2Statement.executeWithFlags(AbstractJdbc2Statement.java:388)
	at org.postgresql.jdbc2.AbstractJdbc2Statement.executeUpdate(AbstractJdbc2Statement.java:334)

	at com.atlassian.greenhopper.manager.lexorank.LexoRankDaoImpl.createBulk(LexoRankDaoImpl.java:123)
	... 298 more
{code}
* The result is JIRA Agile's AO tables in a half upgraded state.

h4. Cause
JIRA Agile 6.4.0.3 introduces the new Lexoranking system. During the migration, the SQL queries use multi-row values, which are not compatible with PostgreSQL 8.1. These were introduced as of PostgreSQL 8.2.

h4.Solution
Since the problem occurs with PostgreSQL 8.1 which is not supported, the problem could be solved by switching to a supported database.
* The list of supported databases are available at [Supported Platforms|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA062/Supported+Platforms].
* Use the [Switching Databases|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA062/Switching+Databases] to move to a supported database.
fields.summary: Upgrade to JIRA Agile 6.4 fails with PostgreSQL 8.1

fields.description:
As a product owner, I want to be able to reorder the fixversions in the version column so that I can move to the top the ones that I want to work with. 

Currently, right now, every version appears for the projects that my filter is associated with. So, I have 15-20 versions appearing and have to scroll to locate the versions that I want to focus on.
fields.summary: Reorder fixversions

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
As a product owner that manages a team that works on a variety of projects at one time, 
I want only the fixversions that are associated with the issues that I have included in my filter to display in the versions column of the scrum board
To reduce the amount of noise and scrolling required to work with the board and our team's backlog. 

Right now, we have teams that work on issues that may cross 3-5 different projects, even more.  We create a scrum board based on labels that identify the team. 

However, the board displays every unarchived version associated with every project that the filter's query is associated with.  And, it's not clear, without expanding each version, which have issues associated it. 

The versions functionality should be consistent with the epics in that only those epics that meet the filter criteria appear on the board - not every epic associated with the project that the filter is associated with.
fields.summary: Do not include fixversions that aren't relevant to the filter

fields.description:

Proposal:
Possibility to maintain fav. Boards under Profile (feature should behave like maintaining quick filter)
Depending on that order some new buttons are show at the top menu (next to "Create" button.
If you click on one of these buttons, it goes directly into the planing site of the board.

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Status as of 23rd July 2014|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5| titleBGColor=#3C78B5| bgColor=#E7F4FA}

Dear Customers,

This bug was fixed in JIRA Agile 6.4.3, which will help prevent future rank data corruption from occurring.

The new release *does not* attempt to automatically correct any existing rank data corruption that may be present as a result of installing JIRA Agile 6.4.x. The reason behind this is because we feel that the best way to deal with existing cases is with the help of our Support Team.

If you are upgrading an instance which previously had a 6.4.x version installed, and you find that your problems persist, please [contact our Support Team|https://support.atlassian.com] so that they can investigate the state of your ranking data and provide a faster resolution.

We thank you for your continued patience and hope that you appreciate our open communication style.

Regards,

JIRA Agile Team

{panel}

h3. Symptoms 
- You're using an Oracle database 
- You're running JAG 6.4.x 
- Creating a new issue is slow and the jira logs have the following warning message 
{code}2014-07-02 09:11:26,257 http-bio-8080-exec-97 WARN xxxxxx 551x7454x6 1hz4f54 xxx.xxx.10.xxx,192.xxx.1.12 /secure/QuickCreateIssue.jspa [greenhopper.customfield.lexorank.LexoRankIndexer] Could not retrieve LexoRank value for issue[id=123317]. Indexing max LexoRank value {code} 

Some Oracle configurations don't surface the problem however. To confirm your system is affected run these two queries: 

{code} 
SELECT * FROM "AO_60DB71_LEXORANK" WHERE "FIELD_ID" = *insert rank field id here* AND ROWNUM <=2 ORDER BY "RANK" DESC; 
{code} 

{code} 
SELECT "RANK" FROM (SELECT * FROM "AO_60DB71_LEXORANK" WHERE "FIELD_ID" = *insert rank field id here* ORDER BY "RANK" DESC) WHERE ROWNUM <=2 ; 
{code} 

If both return the same 2 rows, then it is good. If they differ the ranking in JAG will not work properly. 

To find the *Rank field ID*, follow the steps below: 
# Go to Administration > Issues > Custom Fields. 
# Find the *Rank* custom field. 
# Click on the Cog Icon > View. 
# The URL will change similarly to the example below: 
{noformat} 
http://yourjira/secure/admin/ConfigureCustomField!default.jspa?customFieldId=10005 
{noformat} 
In this example the Rank Field ID is *10005*. 

h3. Root cause 

LexoRank code uses a custom SQL select statement to get rank rows and limits the results using a db specific clause. In Oracle's case this is the pseudocolumn ROWNUM. 

We use this column to limit the results, but in a wrong way. We want a query to be sorted by the order by clause before limiting the results. The way we use it will mean we get the first n rows and then sort those rows based on the order by clause. 

http://docs.oracle.com/cd/B28359_01/server.111/b28286/pseudocolumns009.htm#SQLRF00255

h3.Workaround 

Rollback the JIRA Agile add-on to 6.3.13.1 as per the below steps. 

(!) {color:red}*The only version that can be rolled back to is 6.3.13.1. Any other version will cause significant problems*{color}. (!) 

# Unlock the rank fields as per [How to unlock a Locked field|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AGILEKB/How+to+unlock+a+Locked+field]. 
# From JIRA Administration > Issues > Custom Fields (left side menu), rename the rank fields to something else, for example Rank (LexoRank). 
# Rename the old (Obsolete) fields to their original name 'Rank'. 
# From JIRA Administration > Manage Add-ons, uninstall JIRA Agile. 
# Stop JIRA. 
# Roll-back the JIRA Agile version in the database with the following SQL: 
{code:SQL} 
UPDATE propertynumber SET propertyvalue = 42 WHERE id = (SELECT id FROM propertyentry WHERE property_key = 'GreenHopper.Upgrade.Latest.Upgraded.Version'); 
UPDATE propertystring SET propertyvalue = '42' WHERE id = (SELECT id FROM propertyentry WHERE property_key = 'com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira:build'); 
{code} 
# Start JIRA. 
# Install the previous version of JIRA Agile [6.3.13.1|http://maven.atlassian.com/content/repositories/atlassian-public/com/atlassian/jira/plugins/jira-greenhopper-plugin/6.3.13.1/jira-greenhopper-plugin-6.3.13.1.jar]. From JIRA Administration > Add-ons > Manage Add-ons (left side menu), choose 'Upload Add-on' and provide the URL or upload from your computer. 
# Reindex JIRA.
fields.summary: Use of ROWNUM in Oracle select statement incorrect

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Software Server*. Using *JIRA Software Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWCLOUD-10904].
  {panel}

When attaching a screenshot via JIRA Agile, Ctrl + V (win) or Cmd + V (mac) does not paste image

*Steps to reproduce:*
1. Open an issue in JIRA Agile
2. Click [...] icon and select 'attach screenshot'
3. Follow directions to take a screenshot, then paste the image.
4. The image is not pasted into the indicated area on screen

note - pasting the screenshot into another application works 

*Workaround*
Paste the image after opening the issue in JIRA rather than JIRA Agile
fields.summary: When attaching a screenshot via JIRA Agile, Ctrl + V (win) or Cmd + V (mac) does not paste image

fields.description:
The _name_ used for the field should be a _canonical_ name in English to be consistent with JIRA's own system fields and so that the experience of choosing a field in the issue navigator in JQL mode is consistent and fields are only shown in one language when the user is entering or viewing a JQL query. Otherwise, situations like the one described at JRA-39009 happen.

JIRA Agile should provide _translations_ for its own custom fields if available. Translations for custom fields is a supported feature since JIRA 6.0 and we should translate JIRA Agile custom fields via that mechanism.

fields.description:
In prior versions of JA (I believe 6.2 and below?), one could quickly drag  an issue in a sprint to a different, off-page position on the Plan view of the rapid boards using the multitouch features on the Mac trackpad.

For example, if I wanted to grab and issue and drag it two pages down to reorder it in a spring, I would simply do a "hard" click on the trackpad to select the issue, and then simultaneously do a two-finger swipe with my other fingers in order to flick and very quickly scroll the sprint up or down, and then release the hard click of the issue when it was in the right place.

In JA 6.3+, the two-finger swipe no longer works when I have the hard click depressed to "pick up" an issue. In order to accomplish the same task, I need to drag the issue down past the edge of the window, and then wait while it s.l.o.w.l.y drags down.

This problem is made more infuriating because dragging an issue off the end of the sprint in Safari causes the sprint to scroll down only a tiny bit...and it then stops completely. I need to jiggle the trackpad to keep moving the issue down again, which is a very, very slow operation, and it stops moving whenever I stop moving the pointer.

This makes it take 5-10X as long to reposition a single issue if one has a lot of issues to move over.

The same problems occur in Chrome as well.
fields.summary: Multi-touch scrolling of sprint is broken while an issue is click-selected

The problem with that is that the user ends up performing an unintended action (creating issue outside of intended context) because of his limited permissions.

(/) The better way may be to check the required project permissions first, and give the user a choice to go ahead and create the issue outside the epic if he lacks the edit issue permission; otherwise, simply disallow the use of this feature for a user without the required permission to complete it successfully.

(i) _I have not raised this as a bug because an error message does pop up during this operation stating that the user doesn't have edit issue permission for the epic or the newly created issue as the case may be. However, it probably still doesn't make any sense to allow creating the issue outside the epic anyway without atleast a warning dialog to the customer of the outcome of his action if he chooses to continue._

fields.description: If you are looking at url {{https://<jira-url>/secure/RapidBoard.jspa?rapidView=XXX}} as {{USER-A}}, and then you navigate to {{http://<jira-url>/login.jsp?os_username=USER-B&os_password=USER-B-PW&os_destination=secure/RapidBoard.jspa}}, this will log you in as {{USER-B}} and send you to a rapid board. It SHOULD send you to the most recently viewed board for {{USER-B}} (board {{YYY}} for example), but instead it queries the {{lastRapidViewId}} key in localStorage, which is not user-specific, and sends you to the most recently viewed board for anyone (in this case {{XXX}}). {{USER-B}} may not have permission to view board {{XXX}}, so this is an inconvenience for them, since they see a permissions error on login.

fields.description:
If a filter has certain statuses excluded, for example the below, it will break the chart calculations.

{noformat}
project in ("WRM", "WP", "TOOLS") AND ( status not in ("Complete", "Closed") OR Sprint in openSprints() ) AND issuetype in standardIssueTypes() order by Rank ASC
{noformat}

The planning board will exclude issues in the right-most (eg Done) column as per [Using Plan Mode|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AGILE/Using+Plan+Mode]. This means there isn't a need to exclude those issues using a filter, as their status can be dragged to 'Done'.

If they are excluded, when chart calculations such as the burndown chart are done, it will break the charts so they don't appear correctly as per the example screenshots.

I wasn't sure of the best place to put this, it should be in the core docs rather than a KB but not sure where.
fields.summary: Document the behaviour of adding certain statuses to a filter on Scrum board

fields.description:
Currently, as long as two (or more) different boards have the same project in the filter, whatever sprint involving the shared project would be shown in the other board as well.

This can cause some problems if a board creates a sprint, but the other board adds/removes issues from the sprint. For example :

* There are two boards, A and B
* Board A manages project I and II
* Board B manages projects II and III
* Board A creates a sprint involving project II. Board B can view this sprint as well (but they do not participate in it)
* Board B accidentally changes the issues within the sprint, possibly causing problems with the statistics of Board A

As you might be able to imagine, this can cause complications within the boards and the teams. As such, it would be great if there is some method to restrict who can add/remove issues from specific sprints.
fields.summary: Restrict who can add/remove issues from Sprints

Some users may think a new issue should put it to the bottom of the backlog to prevent accidentally giving the issue a priority while others may prefer the current behavior, so giving the ability to chose which suits better for the users would be great.

h4.Workarounds
# Stop JIRA.
# [Update the Universal Plugin Manager (Add-on Manager) by file replacement|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/UPM/Updating+the+Universal+Plugin+Manager#UpdatingtheUniversalPluginManager-UpdatingUPMbyfilereplacement]

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
When trying to rearrange issues in the backlog or in Work mode, an error is displayed and it is impossible to reorder issues.

Error message: "JIRA Agile cannot execute the rank operation at this time. Other users may be ranking the issues that you are trying to rank. Please try again later."

*How to verify:*
When running the following query on the Jira database:
{code}SELECT "FIELD_ID", COUNT(1), "RANK" FROM "AO_60DB71_LEXORANK" GROUP BY "FIELD_ID", "RANK" HAVING COUNT(1) > 1;{code} 1 or more lines are returned with duplicate ranks.
fields.summary: Unable to Rank issues: Error: "Other users may be ranking the issues that you are trying to rank."

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description: An organization has two instances of JIRA running that are linked via the Application Links functionality (one OnDemand and the other is a standalone instance).  The admin of these instances would like to manage projects on the standalone instance that originated on the OnDemand instance (and vice versa) using the existing Agile board.  For example, Project X is created on the OnDemand instance which is a public-facing instance and issues are created against it.   On the standalone instance (behind a firewall and not public facing), Project Y and Z already exist.  The admin of the standalone instance would then like to be able to create boards and manage issues in Project X on that standalone instance, so that they could manage all three Projects from one instance.
fields.summary: As a JIRA Agile user, I would like to manage projects across linked instances of JIRA in a single JIRA Agile board

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
If a user has set the *Rank* Field as the ranking field for the Classic Board, and tries to create a new Issue via the _New Card_ Dialog and gives the issue a Ranking (ie. before ISSUE-30) an error will be shown.

{quote}
Error occurred while creating issue. This could be due to a plugin being incompatible with this version of JIRA. For more details please consult the logs, and see: http://confluence.atlassian.com/x/3McB:  Failed to create Issue.
{quote}

The logs will have the same message.
This does not happen if no ranking is selected and it defaults to _last_.

*Workaround*
* Disable the Ranking for the Classic Board
or
* Create issues via JIRAs own _Create Issue_ button, rather than the _new Card_ button.
fields.summary: Issue Creation fails on Classic Board if trying to rank the issue on the creation screen

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
This issue is present in Jira On-Demand.  We are seeing an accurate burn down chart for the work done in our sprint, but when we look at the report we are seeing that most of the items represented in the burn down chart show as 'Issues Removed From Sprint'.  This has an adverse impact on our velocity chart.  Also all of these issues were closed or resolved and show the status of Ready for QA, which is also wrong.

I have attached screenshots of both.

I am reporting this as a bug, as we have not changed our processes around managing sprints, or sprint items, and I see there was a release to On-Demand in late May 2014.
fields.summary: Stories/Tickets incorrectly showing as "Issues Removed From Sprint" in Sprint Report

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
We really like the "Release..." button on the Kanban board that takes all issues in the last column on the kanban board and creates a Version as specified and then sets the fixVersion of each of those issues to that version. However, in some cases we don't want to mark that Version as "Released" but rather just update the fixVersion field - declaring that that issue will go into that new version you specify, but not necessarily saying that that version is released.
Is it possible to have a dropdown on that "Release..." box with the Version options on the Version Management page (Released, Archived, etc.)

I attached an example UI of what I'm talking about, although there are other ways this could be accomplished (such as a checkbox "Create Version and assign fixVersion field, but do not mark as released")
fields.summary: Allow "Release..." on Kanban board to have a drop for release status

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.summary: How can I get the source code of JIRA Agile (I do have a commercial license)

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
To help manage a large backlog and select relevant issues to go into a sprint I want to be able to quickly and dynamically filter the view of cards on the planning board by clicking on the name of any of the available Components in my project.

The way the Classic Boards does this is excellent. You have transposed and provided this quick filter functionality for Versions and Epics with the left-hand filter panels, so it would be appreciated it the same could be done for Components.

An alternative, (albeit less user-friendly) would be to provide a JQL box alongside the quick filters which allows dynamic filters to be crated on the fly (component = "Widget-33").

The same filtering ability would also be useful in Work mode as well as Plan mode.

Once this is in place we have no more barriers to using the new rapid boards and can move off the (still excellent) Classic Boards.
fields.summary: As a JIRA Agile user I would like to filter the cards displayed in the Backlog by component so that I have at least as much functionality as I have on the Classic Boards

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Now that the StatusCategory property exists, it would be much easier to work with Epics if the behavior around the "Epic Status" field could be deprecated in favor of the StatusCategory property.

A PO would set-up a Kanban board to work with (and eventually plan - see GHS-6175) Epic-level items and this would be reflected in the Scrum boards automatically.
fields.summary: As a PO, I want the Epic status field to match the StatusCategory of the Epic so that I can work with a Kanban board

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
We have a custom workflow and a custom Work board with 8 columns.

We would like the entire Issue title to be displayed on the cards (which would result in a vertical browser scroll bar) on the board as currently only a few words (dependent on browser window width) are shown and we need to hover over the card to display the full title in a tool tip.
fields.summary: As a user I would like to configure the Agile Work Board layout

When viewing the worklogs in the right side-pane of JIRA Agile, the logs do not appear until the worklogs for either "My Worklogs" or "All Worklogs" has been clicked. See images below for details.
!agile_panel.png!

!agile_panel_after_clicking_AllWorklogs.png!

fields.description:
After creating a Sample Scrum Project (Agile > Getting Started > Create a Sample Project), the project's description will be automatically created as follows: {quote} This is a sample Scrum project for JIRA Agile.

Sample Sprint 1 started 21 days 10 hours 20 minutes ago ends 7 days 10 hours 20 minutes ago completed 7 days 11 hours 40 minutes ago

Sample Sprint 2 started 7 days 9 hours 10 minutes ago ends 6 days 15 hours 10 minutes

{quote} We should remove those {{
}} html tags.
fields.summary: Fix Sample Scrum Project's Description

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Steps to repro:
1. Go to Agile getting started page
2. Create a new Scrum board (new project & board -> any names, project key=AAAA -> Agile simplified workflow=checked)
3. Delete board and project
4. Go back to agile getting started page
5. Create a new Kanbam board (new project & board -> any names, project key=AAAA -> Agile simplified workflow=checked)

Expected:
- Project & Board workflows to contain the Kanban simplified workflow states (backlog, selected for dev, in progress, done)

Actual:
- Project contains the Scrum workflow (todo, in progress, done)
- Board contains the Kanban workflow (backlog, selected for dev, in progress, done)
fields.summary: Re-using an old project code when creating a new board/project results in incompatible workflows

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Changed this to a bug. After some digging, I found that it seems this just changed suddenly in our system. The only thing I can think of that changed was that I used the importer for tasks and had the Epic Name field in the document. 

---------------

Currently the field 'Epic Name' shows up when creating tasks as a required field. I don't see how this makes sense, because I'm not creating an epic; I'm creating a task. This field is locked, so I cannot remove 'task' as an available context under the custom fields admin screen. 

Right now the workaround that we're doing is creating it as an enhancement and then editing the ticket (changing to a task) after it's created.
fields.summary: Epic Name was added as a required field for Tasks and we cannot remove it

fields.description:
The "Resize Detail View" button in the Planning view doesn't actually work on the button, only around the edges. As our usage of Agile goes up this is becoming a frequent complaint among our users, especially the high maintenance developers. 

See the image below - only the blue areas work, the middle area is dead. 

!Capture.PNG!
fields.summary: Resize Detail View control is misaligned/dead spot

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Current behaviour

Currently the story points can only be used as a number field (to type the value manually).

h3. Expected behaviour

We would to have the ability to configure the story points field as a drop down field with pre-configured values.
fields.summary: As an Administrator, I would like to configure the story points to work as a drop down

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
"Give feedback" button is visible after disabling the feedback module of JIRA Agile plugin. 

Steps to reproduce:

* Disable the Feedback module of JIRA Agile plugin
* Access a Scrum board and switch to Report mode
* Enable enhanced reports by clicking "Enable" button
* "Give feedback" button is visible

Please wrap the button in the feedback plugin module so that button is invisible after disabling feedback module.
fields.summary: Add "Give feedback" button to feedback plugin module

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Every load of the Rapid Boards retrieves the sprint custom field ID from the database. The way the code is structured is such that the method used to retrieve the data is synchronised - this means any latency on that retrieval can cause significant thread congestion, presenting in an instance appearing to be unresponsive or experiencing performance problems.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

Load the rapid view board under high load.

h3. Expected Results

The board consistently loads without error.

h3. Actual Results

One of the database retrieval operations may take some time to complete, if this occurs congestion can apply to a number of threads. In worse-case 10 to 100s of threads may block waiting for the operation to complete.

h3. Verification

Review the thread dumps to verify if there is congestion on the {{com.atlassian.greenhopper.service.sprint.SprintCustomFieldServiceImpl}} monitor, specifically there are a number of threads waiting for it as per the attached screenshot. They can also be analysed with the following:

{noformat}
grep "waiting to lock.*SprintCustomFieldServiceImpl" jira_threads* | awk '{print $1}' |sort |uniq -c
   1 jira_threads.1424257020.txt:
  42 jira_threads.1424689917.txt:
{noformat}

In {{jira_threads.1424689917.txt}} we can see 42 threads are waiting - this would imply that thread dump is affected with that problem.

h3. Notes

Upgrading to JIRA 6.2 or higher has been known to improve the problem.
fields.summary: Refactor SprintCustomFieldManagerImpl to use more fine-grained locking

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
In Chrome -
1) Navigate to Agile -> Classic
2) Select a Project
3) Tools -> Configuration
4) Select the Card Styles tab
5) In the Card View section, click on a field and try to move it to a new location on the card.

Expected Result:
The field will be dragged and eventually dropped into the new desired location on the card view.

Actual Result:
The entire screen scrolls up or down (depending on where you try to drop the field).  The field will either appear at the top or bottom of the card.  You cannot effectively move the field to a desired location.

Workaround:
Use a different browser
fields.summary: Cannot reposition fields in Classic Card Styles configuration in Chrome

project.name: Jira Software Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Software Server*. Using *JIRA Software Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWCLOUD-10819].
  {panel}

JAG uses JIRA's property sets to store configurations. We frequently access these property sets in various services (ex. SprintCustomFieldServiceImpl). 

However we don't cache these property sets, thus resulting in a lot of unnecessary  db access to retrieve the data for the sets each time we want to read a property.

We should apply an appropriate caching strategy for these property sets.

This has appeared to cause significant bottlenecking in a customer instance, where almost every JIRA Agile thread is blocked on a thread waiting on a response from the database due. Screenshot of threads attached.
fields.summary: Cache frequently used PropertySets

fields.description:
We had an incident where a user used a JQL query that returned about
1,700 Epics in their Planning Board.

{{PlanningModeResource.getBacklogData()}} took about 60 seconds to complete on it's own (300s+ as load increased).

With several users loading the board at the same time, it brought the system CPU usage levels to critical.
fields.summary: A JQL query that returns a lot of Epics on the Planning Board can cause high CPU load
